intro: Myrsine penibukana, commonly known as the Bornean myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by red, fleshy berries. It is native to the rainforests of Borneo and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
